column4: HELP! SUDO COMMAND WILL NOT WORK! I GET THE ERROR MESSAGE: "sudo: must be setuid root

PLEASE HELP!
2005-11-17T09:15:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	turn of caps lock plz
2005-11-17T09:15:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	try to remain calm
2005-11-17T09:16:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	ok explain your circumstance in detail please
2005-11-17T09:17:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	have you just installed?
2005-11-17T09:17:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	did you use expert install ?
2005-11-17T09:18:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	what have you done since installing that might have caused this?
2005-11-17T09:20:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	you might have to use recovery mode to view your sudoers file
2005-11-17T09:21:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	I think you should seek advice next time before you try to 'fix things'
2005-11-17T09:22:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	have you done much since installing?  Is reinstalling an option?
2005-11-17T09:23:00.000Z	PukingGeko	mustard5	-> that's what i need, huh?
2005-11-17T09:23:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	come back here and seek advice on how to do stuff..thats what i would do yes
2005-11-17T09:23:00.000Z	PukingGeko	mustard5	-> alright... thanks
2005-11-17T09:23:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	you've made a mess and it will be messy to fix
2005-11-17T09:24:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	the easy option is 'start again' but seek advice first
2005-11-17T09:24:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	we can walk you through it all next time
2005-11-17T09:25:00.000Z	mustard5	PukingGeko	good luck
